<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/recapping-historically-busy-ipo-market?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is Oprah Running the IPO Market?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Oprah handing out IPOs meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjU5L29wcmFoX2lwby5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you thought WFH has made your life busier, the market for public offerings has you beat. At least 17 companies <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-ipo/u-s-ipo-market-channels-spirit-of-99-to-tee-up-bumper-2020-idUSKBN25O2GZ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> in the U.S. last week—the most active week in the last five years, according to Refinitiv. Let’s see who’s been practicing their bell ringing in the mirror.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Never heard of it but should</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Snowflake: </strong>Founded by former Oracle developers eight years ago, Snowflake harnesses the power of the cloud to make big datasets more accessible. It’s okay if you don’t really know what that means because Snowflake’s business customers do: Its revenue <a href="https://fortune.com/2020/08/29/2020-ipos-palantir-tech-ipo-asana-snowflake-predictions/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew 174%</a> to $265 million in fiscal 2019.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Best of the rest:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Unity</strong></span><span> is a videogame engine that powers </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/video-game-engine-maker-unity-files-go-public?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over half</a></span><span> of the 1,000 most popular games in both Apple's and Google’s app stores. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">JFrog</strong></span><span> makes tools for software developers and reported more than $100 million in revenue in 2019. But the best part of this IPO is the ticker: FROG. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sumo</strong></span><span> </span><span><strong style="color:#000">Logic</strong></span><span> is another data analytics company, who, you guessed it, is cloud-based. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Asana </strong></span><span>is a project management software company with a familiar tech founder—Dustin Moskovitz also helped start a little company called Facebook. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Heard of it but don’t really know what they do</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Palantir:</strong> Another company that you can broadly describe as a big data analytics firm, Palantir was founded in 2003 by a group that includes famous investor Peter Thiel. Worth more than $20 billion, it's one of the most valuable private tech companies—but it's not profitable. Last week, Palantir revealed a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/25/palantir-files-s-1-before-going-public.html#:~:text=The%20data%20analytics%20company%20co,customers%2C%20according%20to%20Tuesday's%20filing.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$588 million loss</a> in 2019 despite plenty of customers in government and defense.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In its paperwork released last week, CEO Alex Karp </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/palantir-takes-swings-at-silicon-valley-on-its-way-to-wall-street-2020-08-25?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lashed out</a></span><span> against Silicon Valley culture, which is a big deal for a company founded and nurtured in Silicon Valley. Palantir's leaving for Denver. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The other big ones</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">DoorDash</strong>, the food delivery company, reportedly <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-22/doordash-is-said-to-plan-fourth-quarter-ipo-after-pandemic-delay?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made moves</a> last week to go public in Q4 of this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Airbnb:</strong> After bookings declined 70% in May as the pandemic decimated its business, Airbnb’s long-rumored IPO seemed to be off the table. But people started getting bored of their own houses and (a slimmed-down) Airbnb cemented its comeback by <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/19/airbnb-confidentially-files-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filing confidentially</a> to go public a few weeks ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ant Group: </strong>The Chinese fintech titan and Alibaba offshoot plans to raise over $30 billion in a historically huge IPO in Asia. It could push 2020’s tech IPO haul past $57 billion, the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-30/jack-ma-s-ant-fuels-tech-ipo-frenzy-not-seen-since-dotcom-bubble?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second-highest amount</a> since 1999’s internet bonanza. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>After a few quiet moments in the spring, the IPO market is stiff-arming the pandemic and setting itself up for a record-setting year. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/united-scraps-ticket-change-fees-us-passengers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
United Airlines Sends Change Fees to the Exit Row
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Joke from the movie Airplane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=350 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7qE2HzB4rOFQr4zK/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Joke from the movie Airplane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7qE2HzB4rOFQr4zK/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sign of the times: </strong>an airline is actually <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-united-arlns-fees/united-airlines-bids-farewell-to-change-fees-in-push-for-bookings-idUSKBN25Q0TV?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>removing</em> fees</a> rather than adding them. Yesterday, United said it’s permanently getting rid of its change fees for most U.S. plane tickets effective immediately. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Typically, it costs $200 to admit you were a little buzzed and accidentally booked a flight to Charleston, West Virginia, instead of Charleston, South Carolina. But with air passenger levels <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-30/united-air-scraps-hated-u-s-change-fees-in-quest-to-woo-flyers?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">70% below normal</a>, United is hoping a little customer service will go a long way. Getting rid of change fees was often the top customer request in the United suggestion box, said CEO Scott Kirby. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airlines had granted waivers on change fees during the pandemic, but United is the first among them to make it permanent.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Well...besides Southwest. It didn’t charge passengers to swap tickets in the first place.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what’s it mean for the biz? </strong>Ancillary fees were a growing revenue stream for airlines. United collected $625 million from change and cancellation charges last year; the entire U.S. industry—$2.8 billion.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/30/updated-chinese-laws-complicate-sale-tiktoks-us-assets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Wrinkliest Story of 2020 Just Got Wrinklier
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Walmart TikTok deal represented by a TikTok phone in a Walmart cart" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjQyL3Rpa3Rva19waG9uZV9pbl9hX3dhbG1hcnRfc2hvcHBpbmdfY2FydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China is putting up one of those CVS-style glass cases around TikTok. Late on Friday, its government made changes to tech export laws that could <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-tiktok-china/chinas-new-tech-export-controls-could-give-beijing-a-say-in-tiktok-sale-idUSKBN25Q05Q?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hamstring</a> ByteDance’s attempted sale of TikTok’s U.S. operations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> This month, President Trump decided to force ByteDance to divest TikTok's U.S. business, prompting the likes of Microsoft, Oracle, and anyone with more than 100 Twitter followers to submit bids for the super popular video app. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s new:</strong> There are more hoops to jump through. For the first time in 12 years, China updated a list of technologies that are banned or restricted from being exported abroad to include a technology that sounds a whole lot like TikTok’s secret sauce: Its powerful recommendation algorithm.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The fallout: </strong>This is a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/29/technology/china-tiktok-export-controls.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big-time flex</a> by China, “It could be an effort to outright block the sale, or just raise the price, or attach conditions to it to give China leverage down the road,” Chinese economic policy expert Scott Kennedy told the NYT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Tariffs...Huawei...add TikTok to the list of geopolitical football games China and the U.S. are currently playing.</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For many, the world of crypto used to mean listening to your roommate drone on about things they didn’t actually know about and then deciding maybe you’d ask the internet how it works before doing absolutely nothing about it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But times change. Your roommate moved out, you gained some financial wisdom over the years, and we told you about <a href="https://try.blockfi.com/morningbrew/?ref=morningbrew25&utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=partner&utm_campaign=us_morningbrew_biapromoaug2020&utm_content=newsletter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">BlockFi</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And it’s quite the bridge—the <a href="https://try.blockfi.com/morningbrew/?ref=morningbrew25&utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=partner&utm_campaign=us_morningbrew_biapromoaug2020&utm_content=newsletter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">BlockFi Interest Account</a> can earn you <strong style="color:#000">up to 8.6% APY</strong>, so you can put your crypto to work.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/30/tesla-apples-planned-stock-splits-go-effect-today?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stocks Do the Splits
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="James Brown" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=499 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjHQKtDXpeGN9rW0/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="James Brown" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjHQKtDXpeGN9rW0/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, stock splits for both Apple (4-1) and its partner-in-hypergrowth Tesla (5-1) will go into effect.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What exactly does that mean? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/what-stock-split-why-do-stocks-split/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stock split</a> is when a public company gives more shares to existing shareholders, while chopping the price of each share so the total value of those holdings doesn't change. A 5-1 stock split for Tesla means shareholders get five shares for every one they currently have, but the price will drop from $2,213/share to about $443. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The idea is to make a stock look more attractive to investors who can't stomach paying more than $2,000 for one share (although that's less relevant now that brokerages offer </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-stocksplit-investors-preview/apple-and-tesla-split-their-shares-but-does-it-matter-idUSKBN25O1BN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fractional shares</a></span><span>). </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Stock splits have no bearing on a company’s value, the same way cutting a pizza into 16 slices instead of eight doesn’t give you more pizza. But Apple's and Tesla's stocks are booming regardless: Apple’s stock is up 30% since announcing its stock split in late July; Tesla's has jumped 61% since its August 11 announcement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here:</strong> Today is also the first day of trading for the new-look Dow Jones Industrial Average. Salesforce, Amgen, and Honeywell are replacing ExxonMobil, Pfizer, and Raytheon in the index...a decision <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/major-shakeup-dow?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">motivated</a> by Apple's stock split. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>On Mondays, we present some of the most complex business topics of the day, give you a few balanced resources, and encourage you to discuss with friends, family, and coworkers. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week’s topic: </strong>pot. Next month, the House will likely <a href="https://www.foxnews.com/politics/historic-vote-marijuana-decriminalization?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vote</a> on a bill to decriminalize marijuana and leave legalization up to the states. Have the last few months changed how lawmakers think about weed?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>COVID-19 has benefitted legal sales of marijuana and chipped away at the illicit market. (</span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/08/02/pandemic-illicit-marijuana-market-390175?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Politico</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How do marijuana taxes work? (</span><span><a href="https://www.taxpolicycenter.org/briefing-book/how-do-marijuana-taxes-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tax Policy Center</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The economic benefits of legalizing weed. (</span><span><a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/insights/110916/economic-benefits-legalizing-weed.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Investopedia</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Pennsylvania’s governor is calling for legalization to help small businesses affected by the pandemic. (</span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/08/26/pennsylvania-marijuana-legalization-supported-by-gov-tom-wolf/5634466002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">USA Today</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Cannabis hasn’t turned into the tax windfall some states expected. (</span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/agenda/story/2019/10/14/marijuana-tax-revenue-001062/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Politico</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

The shooting victim was a supporter of the right-wing group Patriot Prayer, its founder said.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. stocks will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/30/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrap up\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e their best August since the 1980s today. The S\u0026P 500 is up more than 60% since its March low.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/recapping-historically-busy-ipo-market?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIs Oprah Running the IPO Market?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Oprah handing out IPOs meme\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjU5L29wcmFoX2lwby5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eToby Howell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you thought WFH has made your life busier, the market for public offerings has you beat. At least 17 companies \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-ipo/u-s-ipo-market-channels-spirit-of-99-to-tee-up-bumper-2020-idUSKBN25O2GZ?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S. last week—the most active week in the last five years, according to Refinitiv. Let’s see who’s been practicing their bell ringing in the mirror.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNever heard of it but should\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSnowflake: \u003c/strong\u003eFounded by former Oracle developers eight years ago, Snowflake harnesses the power of the cloud to make big datasets more accessible. It’s okay if you don’t really know what that means because Snowflake’s business customers do: Its revenue \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2020/08/29/2020-ipos-palantir-tech-ipo-asana-snowflake-predictions/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrew 174%\u003c/a\u003e to $265 million in fiscal 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBest of the rest:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnity\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e is a videogame engine that powers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/video-game-engine-maker-unity-files-go-public?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover half\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of the 1,000 most popular games in both Apple's and Google’s app stores. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJFrog\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e makes tools for software developers and reported more than $100 million in revenue in 2019. But the best part of this IPO is the ticker: FROG. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSumo\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLogic\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e is another data analytics company, who, you guessed it, is cloud-based. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong data-stringify-type=\"bold\" style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAsana \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eis a project management software company with a familiar tech founder—Dustin Moskovitz also helped start a little company called Facebook. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHeard of it but don’t really know what they do\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePalantir:\u003c/strong\u003e Another company that you can broadly describe as a big data analytics firm, Palantir was founded in 2003 by a group that includes famous investor Peter Thiel. Worth more than $20 billion, it's one of the most valuable private tech companies—but it's not profitable. Last week, Palantir revealed a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/25/palantir-files-s-1-before-going-public.html#:~:text=The%20data%20analytics%20company%20co,customers%2C%20according%20to%20Tuesday's%20filing.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$588 million loss\u003c/a\u003e in 2019 despite plenty of customers in government and defense.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn its paperwork released last week, CEO Alex Karp \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/palantir-takes-swings-at-silicon-valley-on-its-way-to-wall-street-2020-08-25?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elashed out\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e against Silicon Valley culture, which is a big deal for a company founded and nurtured in Silicon Valley. Palantir's leaving for Denver. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe other big ones\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDoorDash\u003c/strong\u003e, the food delivery company, reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-22/doordash-is-said-to-plan-fourth-quarter-ipo-after-pandemic-delay?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade moves\u003c/a\u003e last week to go public in Q4 of this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAirbnb:\u003c/strong\u003e After bookings declined 70% in May as the pandemic decimated its business, Airbnb’s long-rumored IPO seemed to be off the table. But people started getting bored of their own houses and (a slimmed-down) Airbnb cemented its comeback by \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/19/airbnb-confidentially-files-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiling confidentially\u003c/a\u003e to go public a few weeks ago.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnt Group: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Chinese fintech titan and Alibaba offshoot plans to raise over $30 billion in a historically huge IPO in Asia. It could push 2020’s tech IPO haul past $57 billion, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-30/jack-ma-s-ant-fuels-tech-ipo-frenzy-not-seen-since-dotcom-bubble?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecond-highest amount\u003c/a\u003e since 1999’s internet bonanza. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter a few quiet moments in the spring, the IPO market is stiff-arming the pandemic and setting itself up for a record-setting year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSign of the times: \u003c/strong\u003ean airline is actually \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-united-arlns-fees/united-airlines-bids-farewell-to-change-fees-in-push-for-bookings-idUSKBN25Q0TV?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eremoving\u003c/em\u003e fees\u003c/a\u003e rather than adding them. Yesterday, United said it’s permanently getting rid of its change fees for most U.S. plane tickets effective immediately. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTypically, it costs $200 to admit you were a little buzzed and accidentally booked a flight to Charleston, West Virginia, instead of Charleston, South Carolina. But with air passenger levels \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-30/united-air-scraps-hated-u-s-change-fees-in-quest-to-woo-flyers?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e70% below normal\u003c/a\u003e, United is hoping a little customer service will go a long way. Getting rid of change fees was often the top customer request in the United suggestion box, said CEO Scott Kirby. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAirlines had granted waivers on change fees during the pandemic, but United is the first among them to make it permanent.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWell...besides Southwest. It didn’t charge passengers to swap tickets in the first place.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what’s it mean for the biz? \u003c/strong\u003eAncillary fees were a growing revenue stream for airlines. United collected $625 million from change and cancellation charges last year; the entire U.S. industry—$2.8 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChina is putting up one of those CVS-style glass cases around TikTok. Late on Friday, its government made changes to tech export laws that could \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-tiktok-china/chinas-new-tech-export-controls-could-give-beijing-a-say-in-tiktok-sale-idUSKBN25Q05Q?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehamstring\u003c/a\u003e ByteDance’s attempted sale of TikTok’s U.S. operations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e This month, President Trump decided to force ByteDance to divest TikTok's U.S. business, prompting the likes of Microsoft, Oracle, and anyone with more than 100 Twitter followers to submit bids for the super popular video app. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s new:\u003c/strong\u003e There are more hoops to jump through. For the first time in 12 years, China updated a list of technologies that are banned or restricted from being exported abroad to include a technology that sounds a whole lot like TikTok’s secret sauce: Its powerful recommendation algorithm.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe fallout: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/29/technology/china-tiktok-export-controls.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebig-time flex\u003c/a\u003e by China, “It could be an effort to outright block the sale, or just raise the price, or attach conditions to it to give China leverage down the road,” Chinese economic policy expert Scott Kennedy told the NYT.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eTariffs...Huawei...add TikTok to the list of geopolitical style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, stock splits for both Apple (4-1) and its partner-in-hypergrowth Tesla (5-1) will go into effect.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat exactly does that mean? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/what-stock-split-why-do-stocks-split/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estock split\u003c/a\u003e is when a public company gives more shares to existing shareholders, while chopping the price of each share so the total value of those holdings doesn't change. A 5-1 stock split for Tesla means shareholders get five shares for every one they currently have, but the price will drop from $2,213/share to about $443. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe idea is to make a stock look more attractive to investors who can't stomach paying more than $2,000 for one share (although that's less relevant now that brokerages offer \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-stocksplit-investors-preview/apple-and-tesla-split-their-shares-but-does-it-matter-idUSKBN25O1BN?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efractional shares\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eStock splits have no bearing on a company’s value, the same way cutting a pizza into 16 slices instead of eight doesn’t give you more pizza. But Apple's and Tesla's stocks are booming regardless: Apple’s stock is up 30% since announcing its stock split in late July; Tesla's has jumped 61% since its August 11 announcement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here:\u003c/strong\u003e Today is also the first day of trading for the new-look Dow Jones Industrial Average. Salesforce, Amgen, and Honeywell are replacing ExxonMobil, Pfizer, and Raytheon in the index...a decision \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/24/major-shakeup-dow?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emotivated\u003c/a\u003e by Apple's stock split. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
